page.title: 04MURSTON LAKES
page.content: Murston lakes originated from the excavation of brick earth which was used by the nearby brickworks. The three freshwater lakes are an important area for leisure for the residents of Sittingbourne. They are maintained as fishing lakes but they support a wide variety of wildlife. The surrounding area consists of a small wood which is coppiced, many bushes, scattered trees and reedbeds. This provides dense cover for birds and animals. Murston is an important area for migrating birds which often stop to feed. It also has a large population of breeding birds both resident and migratory. The undergrowth is of great variety and provides breeding places for many butterflies. It is hoped that this important area will be preserved for future generations to enjoy.
